Package pegasus.grid

Class IntArrayGrid

java.lang.Object
pegasus.grid.IntArrayGrid
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<Integer>, BaseGrid<Integer>, IntGrid, BinaryIndexedIntIterable
public class IntArrayGrid extends Object implements IntGrid
An array-based int grid.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • IntArrayGrid

      public IntArrayGrid(int rows, int columns)
      Creates a new array grid.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows to initialize
      columns - The number of columns to initialize
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the dimensions are invalid

    • IntArrayGrid

      public IntArrayGrid(int rows, int columns, IntBinaryOperator generator)
      Creates a new array grid.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows to initialize
      columns - The number of columns to initialize
      generator - The generator function to initialize this grid with
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the dimensions are invalid
      NullPointerException - When the provided generator function is null

    • IntArrayGrid

      public IntArrayGrid(IntGrid g)
      Creates a new array grid.
      Parameters:
      g - The grid of which to copy elements from
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When the provided grid g is null

    • IntArrayGrid

      public IntArrayGrid(IntGrid g, int r1, int c1, int r2, int c2)
      Creates a new array grid.
      Parameters:
      g - The grid of which to copy elements from
      r1 - The starting row index at which to start copying values from (inclusive)
      c1 - The starting column index at which to start copying values from (inclusive)
      r2 - The ending row index at which to stop copying values from (exclusive)
      c2 - The ending column index at which to stop copying values from (exclusive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the range produces negative area
      NullPointerException - When the provided grid g is null
      BinaryIndexOutOfBoundsException - When the range is larger than the provided grid g's dimensions

      Returns:
      The resulting grid
      Throws:
      IncompatibleDimensionsException - When the grids' dimensions are different
      NullPointerException - When either the provided grid g or the merger function is null
